meanings.definition: Not providing for the future; lacking foresight or thrift.
meanings.sent1: The improvident squirrel did not save any nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent2: She regretted her improvident decision to spend all her savings on unnecessary items.
meanings.sent3: The improvident rabbit spent all his carrots on a magic show.
meanings.sent4: His improvident behavior left him stranded without any savings in times of need.
meanings.sent5: The improvident student never thought about saving money for college.

meanings.definition: Wasteful or reckless with money or resources.
meanings.sent1: The improvident shopper bought more groceries than needed and wasted food.
meanings.sent2: He was known for his improvident spending habits, always buying things he didn't need.
meanings.sent3: The improvident chef threw away perfectly good ingredients just because he felt like it.
meanings.sent4: Her improvident ways with money led to constant financial struggles.
meanings.sent5: The improvident explorer squandered his supplies and got lost in the wilderness.
